title: 1  R Basics

title: 1  The Tidyverse
text:
The tidyverse can be installed with a single line of code : install.packages(“tidyverse”)
This command loads the nine “core” packages: dplyr, forcats, ggplot2, lubridate, purrr, readr, stringr, tibble, and tidyr. These are considered the core of the tidyverse because you’ll use them in almost every analysis : - dplyr : manipulating data frames - forcats : provides tools for dealing with categorical variables - ggplot2 : producing statistical, or data, graphics - lubridate : makes it easier to work with dates and times in R - purr : working with function
#| label: load-tidyverse #| warning: false #| message: false

library(tidyverse)
